name: src/client.js
constructor
examples:
<caption>Simple instantiation, no authentication needed. E.g. for a user that has already authenticated their account</caption>
new BufferClient({
  access_token: '<your_access_token>',
  client_id: '<your_client_id>',
  client_secret: '<your_client_secret>',
  redirect_url: '<your_redirection_url>'
});

<caption>Force access_token generation with the `authentication` flag</caption>
new BufferClient({
  access_token: '<your_access_token>',
  client_id: '<your_client_id>',
  client_secret: '<your_client_secret>',
  redirect_url: '<your_redirection_url>',
  authenticated: false
}, function (err, res) {
  // Do something here
});

params.name: params
params.description: The access token associated with the registered app

params.name: params.authenticated
params.description: Flag to determine whether the user has been authenticated or not. If false, a long-lived access token will be generated and assigned upon instantiation.

params.name: params.client_id
params.description: The client ID of your Buffer application

params.name: params.client_secret
params.description: The client secret of your Buffer application

params.name: params.access_token
params.description: The access token for the user. If the `authentication` parameter is false, this will be overwritten by the `getAccessToken` method.

params.name: params.redirect_url
params.description: The redirection URL for your Buffer application

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: config
description: The Buffer configuration retrieved from the /info/configuration.json endpoint

name: client
description: The OAuth2 client that will be used to automatically authenticate API URLs

name: promise
description: A promise that will return after the BufferClient instance has been built

name: get
description: Queries an API endpoint using the GET method
examples:
<caption>Using the optional `params` parameter:</caption>
this.get('profiles/4eb854340acb04e870000010/updates/sent.json', {
	page: 2,
	count: 100
}, function (err, res) {
	// Do something
});

<caption>Omitting the optional `params` parameter</caption>
this.get('profiles/4eb854340acb04e870000010/updates/sent.json', function (err, res) {
	// Do something
});

params.name: endpoint
params.description: The API endpoint to query. This should not be the full API URL. Example: 'users.json'

params.name: params
params.description: A list of params to be appended to the URL. If omitted, the default Buffer API attributes will be used.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: post
description: Queries an API endpoint using the POST method
examples:
<caption>Using the optional `params` parameter:</caption>
this.post('profiles/4eb854340acb04e870000010/schedules/update.json', { ... }, function (err, res) {
	// Do something
});

<caption>Omitting the optional `params` parameter</caption>
this.post('user/deauthorize.json', function (err, res) {
	// Do something
});

params.name: endpoint
params.description: The API endpoint to query. This should not be the full API URL. Example: 'users.json'

params.name: params
params.description: A list of params to be appended to the URL. If omitted, the default Buffer API attributes will be used.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getProfiles
description: Gets a list of profiles associated with the authenticated user

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getProfile
description:
Returns a profile object with a given ID.
Note that this does not query the API, so a list of profiles must have been retrieved beforehand.

params.name: profile_id
params.description: The ID of the profile to retrieve

name: deauthorizeUser
description: Revokes access for the Buffer Client to access the API on behalf of the currently logged in user

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getAccessToken
description: Gets a permanent access token when authenticating the user.

params.name: access_token
params.description: The temporary access token assigned when passing through the OAuth gateway

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getAuthorizationUrl
description: Gets the authorization URL for the current app

params.name: client_id
params.description: The client ID you were assigned when registering your Buffer application

params.name: redirect_url
params.description: The redirect URL you set when registering your Buffer application

name: src/modules/profile.js
getByID

params.name: profile_id
params.description: The ID of the profile to retrieve

params.name: callback

name: getPendingUpdates
description: Gets a list of pending updates for a given profile and associates them with this object

params.name: params
params.description: API parameters to pass through to the URL

params.name: callback

name: getSentUpdates
description: Gets a list of sent updates for a given profile and associates them with this object

params.name: params
params.description: API parameters to pass through to the URL

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: reorderUpdates
description: Reorders updates in the user's buffer, given a new order

params.name: params
params.description: API parameters to pass through to the URL. "updates" must be present.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: shuffleUpdates
description: Shuffles updates in the user's buffer at random

params.name: params
params.description: The parameters to send to the API

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getSchedules
description: Returns the schedules set for the current profile

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: setSchedules
description: Overwrites the schedules for the associated profile

params.name: schedules
params.description: The new schedules to send to the API

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: src/modules/update.js
getByID

params.description: The ID of the update to retrieve

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: edit
description: Updates the current status update on the API, then modifies the object to match the edit

params.name: params
params.description: The parameters to update

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: save
description: Saves a status update to the user's buffer

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: destroy
description: Deletes a status update from the user's buffer

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: share
description: Instantly shares an update to the selected account

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: getInteractions
description: Gets interactions (e.g. retweets) from an update with a given ID

params.name: params
params.description: A list of params to be appended to the URL.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled

name: moveToTop
description: Moves the current update to the top of the Buffer queue

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to run when the request has been fulfilled
